bibl.title: Moy Wah v. J. C. Drake. Order
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington

div1.p: As a stated term of the United States Circuit District Court for the District of Washington, Northern Division held at the Court Room in the City of Seattle on Monday the 12th day of June in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and ninety-three.
In the matter of Moy Wah On Habeas Corpus

Now on this 12th day of June, 1892, this matter comes on regularly for hearing upon the petition of the petitioner and the return of the U.S.Marshal, on the writ of habeas corpus issued in this cause; petitioner being represented by Marshall K. Snell, Esq., and the United States Marshal being represented by Wm.H.Brinker, Esqu., United States Attorney, the cause pro- ceeds by the examination of witnesses on behalf of the petition- er until the close thereof, at which time the Court being fully advised in the premises finds that the said petitioner is now unlawfully restrained of his liberty, and it is ordered that the said petition be, and the same is hereby denied and the said petitioner Moy Wah is remanded to the custody of the U.S. Marshal to be by him delivered into the custody of the Collector of Customs for the District of Puget Sound to be by him dealt with as provided by law.
I hereby certify that the foregoing is a full, true and correct copy of an original order made and entered in the above entitled cause, - remanding petitioner.
Attest my hand and seal of said Circuit District Court, this 12th day of June A.D. 1893
United States District Circuit Court, District of Washington.
In re Moy Wah On Habeas Corpus
US Marshals office Dist of Washington
In obedience to the commands of the within writ, the said Moy Wah has this day been, by me, delivered into the custody of the collector of customs for the District of Puget Sound.
